page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our block consists mainly of farmland with the village of Newick approximately at the centre. Part of the hamlet of Piltdown is also in the block. Thus our block is typical rural East Sussex. The population of our block is 2,500 approx. There are three main farm combines but very many farm houses, a reminder of when small, individual, family farms were the order of the day. A disused railway line runs from north to south at the western edge of the block. The River Ouse also runs from north to south. The village of Newick lies between the two. The A272, one of the few east-west roads in Sussex, runs through the block and centre of Newick.
